semantic_title: Patients Admitted with Healed Pressure Ulcers Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 12. Chapter 12: Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Tissue > a. Pressure ulcer stage codes > 4) Patients admitted with pressure ulcers documented as healed

content.full_text: No code is assigned if the documentation states that the pressure ulcer is completely healed at the time of admission. (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)
content.summary: Clear guideline that completely healed pressure ulcers at admission should not be coded (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)
key_concepts: No coding for completely healed ulcers (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)
Admission time assessment (Evidence: pg no: 59, L45)
Complete healing requirement (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)

detailed_rules.rule_text: No code assigned for pressure ulcers completely healed at admission (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation clearly states the pressure ulcer is completely healed at the time of admission, no pressure ulcer code should be assigned (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)

workflow_steps: Step 3: Confirm complete healing at admission
Step 4: Do not assign pressure ulcer code

code_ranges.description: Pressure ulcer codes not used for healed ulcers (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)
code_ranges.requirement: Do not assign when completely healed at admission
usage_rules: Only assign for active pressure ulcers (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient admitted with history of healed sacral pressure ulcer
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient has history of sacral pressure ulcer which is completely healed at time of admission.
step_by_step: Step 1: Note history of pressure ulcer
Step 2: Verify current status - completely healed
Step 3: Confirm healing at admission time
Step 4: Do not assign L89 code

correct_coding.rationale: Completely healed pressure ulcers at admission are not coded (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not code healed pressure ulcers
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding history of pressure ulcers that are healed

breakdown.Documentation: Pressure ulcer completely healed at admission (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)
breakdown.Rationale: Healed ulcers are not active conditions requiring coding

examples.rationale: Only active pressure ulcers require coding (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)

warnings: Do not code pressure ulcers that are completely healed at admission (Evidence: pg no: 59, L44-L45)
best_practices: Distinguish between healed and healing ulcers
common_mistakes: Coding history of healed pressure ulcers
Coding based on past history rather than current status
tips: Look for specific language about complete healing
Check admission assessment for current ulcer status
implementation_notes: Requires clear documentation of healing status
clinical_context: Patients may have history of pressure ulcers
Current status more important than history
